Certainly! Here are some tips for layering fragrances:

1. Choose complementary scents: Make sure the fragrances you choose to layer complement each other. You can stick with fragrances in the same fragrance family or choose ones that have matching notes.

2. Start with a neutral base: To start, use a neutral base scent that will not overpower the other scents. This could be a light lotion or body wash.

3. Apply from lightest to heaviest: Apply the fragrances from the lightest to heaviest. This means start with a body mist or light perfume, then apply a stronger perfume or cologne on top.

4. Don't overdo it: Be careful not to overdo it. If you're going to be layering multiple scents, use a light hand when applying them as too much fragrance can be overwhelming.

5. Experiment: Experiment with different scent combinations to find one that works for you. It's all about finding what smells good to you and makes you feel confident and beautiful.
